trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoIPv4cbgpPeerPrefixLimit[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}>0 and ({Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoIPv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(3600)})>0.9*({Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoIPv4cbgpPeerPrefixLimit[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)})
trigger_prototype.name: Accepted prefixes for IPv4 peer {#SNMPVALUE} as reached the maximum limit

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoVPNv4cbgpPeerPrefixLimit[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}>0 and ({Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoVPNv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(3600)})>0.9*({Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoVPNv4cbgpPeerPrefixLimit[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)})
trigger_prototype.name: Accepted prefixes for VPNv4 peer {#SNMPVALUE} as reached the maximum limit

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPVALUE}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=0 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(#3)}<>6 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerAdminStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=2
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPVALUE} is DOWN
trigger_prototype.description: Trigger for peer that has a remote AS not matching {$BGP_PEER_AS} macro.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerRemoteAs[{#SNMPVALUE}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=1 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(#3)}<>6 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerAdminStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=2
trigger_prototype.name: BGP peer {#SNMPVALUE} is DOWN
trigger_prototype.description: Trigger for peer that has a remote AS matching {$BGP_PEER_AS} macro.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=6 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoIPv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoIPv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: IPv4 BGP peer {#SNMPVALUE} has lost more than 20% of prefixes on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=6 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoIPv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: No prefixes received for IPv4 peer {#SNMPVALUE}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=6 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoVPNv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: No prefixes received for VPNv4 peer {#SNMPVALUE}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoBgpPeerState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=6 and {Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoVPNv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}<0.8*{Template Net Cisco BGP SNMPv2:ciscoVPNv4cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: VPNv4 BGP peer {#SNMPVALUE} has lost more than 20% of prefixes on {HOST.NAME}
